rogel.io.fopl

Class Substitution

  • java.lang.Object
    • rogel.io.fopl.Substitution

  • public final class Substitution
extends java.lang.Object
    A Substitution is a syntactic transformation on Expressions. It consists of a mapping of a set of Variables to a set of Unifiable Objects. It serves as a solution of a unification/resolution problem.
    Author:
    recardona

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Substitution()
      Creates an empty Substitution set.
      Substitution(Substitution s)
      Creates a non-empty Substitution set, comprised of the bindings in the parameter Substitution set.

    • Method Detail

      • unify

        public static Substitution unify(Unifiable arg1,
                 Unifiable arg2,
                 Unifiable... moreArgs)
        Attempts to find the Substitution that unifies (makes syntactically equivalent) the Unifiable arguments. If no such Substitution exists, this method returns null.

        This method is meant as an alternate way to perform the unify method outlined by the Unifiable interface. For example, calling Substitution.unify(u1, u2) is equivalent to calling u1.unify(u2, substitution). This method, however, takes care of providing the initial substitution context, and groups the chain of method calls that would be needed to unify the method's arguments sequentially.

        Parameters:
        arg1 - the first Unifiable argument to unify, not null.
        arg2 - the second Unifiable argument to unify, not null.
        moreArgs - additional Unifiable arguments, not null.
        Returns:
        a Substitution that unifies the arguments, or null if no Substitution exists.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears this Substitution of all bindings.

      • add

        public void add(Variable variable,
       Unifiable unifiable)
        Binds the Term to the Variable.
        Parameters:
        variable - the Variable to be bound, not null.
        unifiable - the Term that will be bound to the variable, not null.

      • getBinding

        public Unifiable getBinding(Variable variable)
        Gets the binding for this Variable. This binding is a Unifiable Object. If no such binding exists, this method returns null.
        Parameters:
        variable - the Variable to lookup, not null.
        Returns:
        the Unifiable Object bound to the variable, or null if the variable is not bound.

      • isBound

        public boolean isBound(Variable variable)
        Checks whether the parameter Variable is bound in this Substitution.
        Parameters:
        variable - the Variable to check for bindings, not null.
        Returns:
        true if the Variable is bound, false otherwise.

      • isGround

        public boolean isGround()
        A Substitution is "ground" if all terms are ground terms (no variables).
        Returns:
        true if this Substitution is ground

      • getBindings

        public java.util.HashMap<Variable,Unifiable> getBindings()
        Gets the Variable, Unifiable object pairs that are mapped in this Substitution.
        Returns:
        the bindings this Substitution represents, as a HashMap of Variables to Unifiable objects.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Compares this Substitution to the parameter object. The result is true if and only if the argument is another Substitution that contains the same Variable, Unifiable bindings as this object.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - The object to compare this Substitution against.
        Returns:
        true if the given object represents a Substitution with the same Variable, Unifiable bindings as this object, false otherwise.

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Returns a hash code for this Substitution. The hash code for a Substitution object is computed as the hash of the Variable, Unifiable entries in the HashMap used to represent a Substitution set times a prime number: i.e. getBindings().hashCode() * 31.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a hash code value for this object.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a String representation of this Substitution, which is a set of Variable, Unifiable pairs. Historically, Substitutions have been denoted by the greek letter 'theta', which precedes the set.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a String representation of this Substitution.
